alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 1:17AM EST until December 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 117 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Rain has come to an end but numerous reports of flooding continue. Excessive runoff will continue and this will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Patten, Ripogenus, Mount Katahdin, Mount Chase, Baxter State Park, Telos Lake, South Branch Pond, Chesuncook, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Lobster Township, Lobster Lake, Frenchtown, Kokadjo, Moosehorn Crossing, Northeast Carry, Shin Pond, Rockwood, Crystal and Beaver Cove. - Numerous reports of secondary roads flooding in low-lying areas and with creeks and streams. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
